intro: Nolana stans, commonly known as the hairy nolana, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and clustered, small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Nolana stans is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
